description:
Fix missing const reference for function parameter.

This issue was found by a linter.

R=atwilson@chromium.org

BUG=

Committed: https://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=218836

messages.text:
No LGTM from a valid reviewer yet. Only full committers are accepted.
Even if an LGTM may have been provided, it was from a non-committer or
a lowly provisional committer, _not_ a full super star committer.
See http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved/become-a-committer
Note that this has nothing to do with OWNERS files.

https://codereview.chromium.org/23111003/diff/1/chrome/browser/background/background_contents_service.cc
File chrome/browser/background/background_contents_service.cc (right):

https://codereview.chromium.org/23111003/diff/1/chrome/browser/background/background_contents_service.cc#newcode59
chrome/browser/background/background_contents_service.cc:59: void CloseBalloon(const std::string& id) {
Does base::Bind() actually do the right thing here (make a local copy of the string, even though the called function just takes a reference?)

PTAnL.

https://codereview.chromium.org/23111003/diff/1/chrome/browser/background/background_contents_service.cc
File chrome/browser/background/background_contents_service.cc (right):

https://codereview.chromium.org/23111003/diff/1/chrome/browser/background/background_contents_service.cc#newcode59
chrome/browser/background/background_contents_service.cc:59: void CloseBalloon(const std::string& id) {
Probably, but the issue here is ... we do an extra copy to pass the parameter "id".
This copy is useless.

On 2013/08/19 14:29:39, Andrew T Wilson wrote:
> Does base::Bind() actually do the right thing here (make a local copy of the
> string, even though the called function just takes a reference?)

Ok, I think I get what you mean.
Supposed bind don't copy it.... in this case, it's just worse, the "id" is scoped only for the function.

On 2013/08/20 03:27:17, etienneb wrote:
> PTAnL.
> 
> https://codereview.chromium.org/23111003/diff/1/chrome/browser/background/background_contents_service.cc
> File chrome/browser/background/background_contents_service.cc (right):
> 
> https://codereview.chromium.org/23111003/diff/1/chrome/browser/background/background_contents_service.cc#newcode59
> chrome/browser/background/background_contents_service.cc:59: void
> CloseBalloon(const std::string& id) {
> Probably, but the issue here is ... we do an extra copy to pass the parameter
> "id".
> This copy is useless.
> 
> On 2013/08/19 14:29:39, Andrew T Wilson wrote:
> > Does base::Bind() actually do the right thing here (make a local copy of the
> > string, even though the called function just takes a reference?)
lgtm. base::Bind() says that pass-by-reference params are copied in the closure.

CQ is trying da patch. Follow status at
https://chromium-status.appspot.com/cq/etienneb@chromium.org/23111003/1

subject: Fix missing const reference for function parameter.
